verses.verse: Rebuke<WG1969> not an elder,<WG4245> but entreat<WG3870> him as a father;<WG3962> and the younger<WG3501> men as brothers;<WG80>
The elder<WG4245> women as mothers;<WG3384> the younger<WG3501> as sisters,<WG79> with all<WG3956> purity.<WG47>
Honor<WG5091> widows<WG5503> that are widows<WG5503> indeed.<WG3689>

But if<WG1487> any<WG5100> widow<WG5503> have<WG2192> children<WG5043> or<WG2228> nephews,<WG1549> let them learn<WG3129> first<WG4412> to show<WG2151> piety<WG2151> at home,<WG2398> and to requite<WG287> <WG591> their parents:<WG4269> for that is good<WG2570> and acceptable<WG587> before<WG1799> God.<WG2316>

Now<WG1161> she that is a widow<WG5503> indeed,<WG3689> and desolate,<WG3443> trusts<WG1679> in God,<WG2316> and continues<WG4357> in supplications<WG1162> and prayers<WG4335> night<WG3571> and day.<WG2250>
But she that lives<WG2198> in pleasure<WG4684> is dead<WG2348> while she lives.<WG2198>
And these<WG5023> things give in charge,<WG3853> that they may be blameless.<WG423>

But if<WG1487> any<WG5100> provide<WG4306> not for his own,<WG2398> and specially<WG3122> for those<WG3588> of his own<WG2398> house,<WG3609> he has denied<WG720> the faith,<WG4102> and is worse<WG5501> than an infidel.<WG571>
Let not a widow<WG5503> be taken<WG2639> into the number<WG2639> under<WG1640> three score<WG1835> years<WG2094> old, having<WG2192> been<WG1096> the wife<WG1135> of one<WG1520> man.<WG435>

Well<WG3140> reported<WG3140> of for good<WG2570> works;<WG2041> if<WG1487> she have<WG2192> brought<WG5044> up children,<WG5044> if<WG1487> she have<WG2192> lodged<WG3580> strangers,<WG3580> if<WG1487> she have<WG2192> washed<WG3538> the saints'<WG40> feet,<WG4228> if<WG1487> she have<WG2192> relieved<WG1884> the afflicted,<WG2346> if<WG1487> she have<WG2192> diligently followed<WG1872> every<WG3956> good<WG18> work.<WG2041>
But the younger<WG3501> widows<WG5503> refuse:<WG3868> for when<WG3752> they have begun<WG2691> to wax<WG2691> wanton<WG2691> against<WG2691> Christ,<WG5547> they will<WG2309> marry;<WG1060>
Having<WG2192> damnation,<WG2917> because<WG3754> they have cast<WG114> off<WG114> their first<WG4413> faith.<WG4102>

And with<WG260> they learn<WG3129> to be idle,<WG692> wandering<WG4022> about<WG4022> from house<WG3614> to house;<WG3614> and not only<WG3440> idle,<WG692> but tattlers<WG5397> also<WG2532> and busybodies,<WG4021> speaking<WG2980> things which<WG3588> they ought<WG1163> not.

I will<WG1014> therefore<WG3767> that the younger<WG3501> women marry,<WG1060> bear<WG5041> children,<WG5041> guide<WG3616> the house,<WG3616> give<WG1325> none<WG3361> occasion<WG874> to the adversary<WG480> to speak reproachfully<WG5484> <WG3059>.
For some<WG5100> are already<WG2235> turned<WG1624> aside<WG1624> after<WG3694> Satan.<WG4567>

If<WG1487> any<WG1536> man or<WG2228> woman that believes<WG4103> have<WG2192> widows,<WG5503> let them relieve<WG1884> them, and let not the church<WG1577> be charged;<WG916> that it may relieve<WG1884> them that are widows<WG5503> indeed.<WG3689>

Let the elders<WG4245> that rule<WG4291> well<WG2573> be counted<WG515> worthy<WG515> of double<WG1362> honor,<WG5092> especially<WG3122> they who labor<WG2872> in the word<WG3056> and doctrine.<WG1319>
For the scripture<WG1124> said,<WG3004> You shall not muzzle<WG5392> the ox<WG1016> that treads<WG248> out the corn. And, The laborer<WG2040> is worthy<WG514> of his reward.<WG3408>
Against<WG2596> an elder<WG4245> receive<WG3858> not an accusation,<WG2724> but before<WG1909> two<WG1417> or<WG2228> three<WG5140> witnesses.<WG3144>
Them that sin<WG264> rebuke<WG1651> before<WG1799> all,<WG3956> that others<WG3062> also<WG2532> may fear.<WG5401> <WG2192>

I charge<WG1263> you before<WG1799> God,<WG2316> and the Lord<WG2962> Jesus<WG2424> Christ,<WG5547> and the elect<WG1588> angels,<WG32> that you observe<WG5442> these<WG5023> things without<WG5565> preferring<WG4299> one before<WG4299> another,<WG4299> doing<WG4160> nothing<WG3367> by partiality.<WG4346>
Lay<WG2007> hands<WG5495> suddenly<WG5030> on<WG2007> no<WG3367> man,<WG3367> neither<WG3366> be partaker<WG2841> of other<WG245> men's sins:<WG266> keep<WG5083> yourself<WG4572> pure.<WG53>
Drink<WG5202> no<WG3371> longer<WG3371> water,<WG5202> but use<WG5530> a little<WG3641> wine<WG3631> for your stomach's<WG4751> sake and your<WG4675> often<WG4437> infirmities.<WG769>
Some<WG5100> men's sins<WG266> are open<WG4271> beforehand,<WG4271> going<WG4254> before<WG4254> to judgment;<WG2920> and some<WG5100> men<WG444> they follow<WG1872> after.<WG1872>
Likewise<WG5615> also<WG2532> the good<WG2570> works<WG2041> of some are manifest<WG4271> beforehand;<WG4271> and they that are otherwise<WG247> cannot<WG3756> <WG1410> be hid.<WG2928>
